page.title: 14I remember Whittlesey
page.content: I've lived in Whittlesey all my life apart from four years when I was at war. The town has changed, not just the buildings but the people in them. I could walk down to the cross and know almost everybody I saw, now you don't even know the traders on the market stalls. I used to have a house that went with my job but since I've retired we have moved to this sheltered housing we have a warden who comes in and checks everything is alright. Until two years ago I had a car but when that failed its M.O.T. we sold it, but I have always used my bike for going around locally. I don't think they were the good old days, if you had ever worked like I've worked on farms where almost every job was done by hand then you'd see how well off people are today.
